question: What minimal self-model contract keeps swarm state coherent across tasks/NEXT.md, tasks/SWARM-LANES.md, and domain frontiers?
method: Structural analysis: enumerate coherence failure modes, map each to a minimal protocol component, verify by examining sessions where coherence failed (L-526, L-517, L-498, L-572). Check if each component is necessary and sufficient.
expect: Identify 3-7 components, all necessary. Expect protocol_handshake and state_vector to be in the set.
actual: Exactly 5 components identified. All necessary (removing any maps to a documented failure mode). Together they are sufficient (any handoff satisfying all 5 has maintained coherence in practice).
diff: Expected 3-7; found exactly 5. Protocol handshake confirmed. State vector confirmed. Additional: identity invariant, write obligation, and active work pointer — each corresponding to a distinct failure mode in the record.

findings.content: {I9 safe, I10 portable, I11 learn, I12 continue}
findings.failure_if_missing: constraint violation — any session can corrupt accumulated state
findings.evidence: beliefs/INVARIANTS.md, test_mission_constraints.py, L-585 (21/51 tests broken for 14 sessions)

findings.content: (L count, P count, B count, F count, session number)
findings.failure_if_missing: repeat work rate ~100% at N>=5 concurrent
findings.evidence: L-526 (planning-obsolescence at N>=3), L-283 (anti-repeat rule), SESSION-LOG.md

findings.content: >=1 NEXT item with blocking status and action
findings.failure_if_missing: sessions default to meta-reflection / safest-option drift
findings.evidence: L-572 (archive blindness), NEXT.md handoff pattern, behavioral analysis S341-S353

findings.content: >=1 verifiable state delta per session (lesson OR principle OR resolved frontier)
findings.evidence: I11 definition in CORE.md, L-220 (empty session pattern), DOMEX requirement

findings.content: read sequence: CORE.md -> INDEX.md before acting
findings.failure_if_missing: belief drift — ISO-17 compliance gap measured across sessions
findings.evidence: L-498 (ISO-17 coherence gap), L-517 (belief freshness decay), drift_scanner.py results

current_overhead: NEXT.md ~50 lines vs theoretical minimum ~5 fields. 10x redundancy — intentional for discoverability, but redundancy is above minimum, not below.
iso_connections: ISO-14 (self-similarity: minimal contract applies recursively to sub-swarms)
successor_frontier: F-META8: Can the minimal contract auto-verify itself? (self-modeling completeness — if contract can check its own satisfaction, coherence maintenance becomes autonomous)
